diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Congenital methemoglobinemia due to deficiency of erythrocytic cytochrome-b5 reductase (recessive congenital methemoglobinemia, type 1)
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Hemoglobin M variant, methemoglobinemia due to drug exposure, hemoglobinopathies.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's persistently low SpO2 values and previous unexplained cyanosis led to suspicion of methemoglobinemia. Co-oximetry confirmed elevated methemoglobin levels, while hemoglobin electrophoresis showed normal patterns, ruling out hemoglobinopathies. The diagnosis of congenital deficiency was supported by reduced cytochrome-b5 reductase activity.
